intro: Hieracium tabescens, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are yellow to white, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium tabescens is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves.
